Charaea luzonicum sp. Nov. (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Galerucinae): The first record of Charaea in the Philippines
Article
Full-text available
  • Sep 2015
  • Jan Bezdek
The first representative of the genus Charaea Baly, 1878, Ch. luzonicum sp. nov., is described from Luzon Island, the Philippines. Based on the characteristic internal sclerites of the aedeagus, the new species belongs to the Ch. coomani species group. Colour photos and drawings of habitus and both male and female genitalia are presented.

New and interesting records of leaf beetles from Moravia (Coleoptera: Megalopodidae, Chrysomelidae)
Article
Full-text available
  • Jan 2015
  • Jan Bezdek
Distributional data of 20 species of leaf beetles from Moravia are presented. Zeugophora frontalis Suffrian, 1840 is newly recorded from Moravia. The occurrence of Neophaedon segnis (Weise, 1884) in Moravia is clarified. Tituboea macropus (Illiger, 1800) is reported from Moravia after at least 40 years.

Caucasian Entomological Bulletin - Insects of the Mediterranean region: old questions, new research trends
Project
Dear colleagues, The editorial board of the journal "Caucasian Entomological Bulletin" invites you to publish your research in our planned special issue (Vol. 14, Supplement 1, 2018) under the theme "Insects of the Mediterranean region: old questions, new research trends". The deadline for submitting the manuscripts is October 1, 2018. The size of manuscripts is unlimited. As long as your entomological paper somehow targets Mediterranean region, the following topics are welcome: - morphology, taxonomy and systematics - evolution and phylogeny - bio- and phylogeography - ecology and morpho-ecological adaptations - fossil insects and paleogeographical reconstructions - new faunistic data "Caucasian Entomological Bulletin" is an open access journal under Creative Common licence CC BY-NC (freely available on the public internet, permitting any users to read, download, copy, distribute, print, search, or link to the full texts of these articles, crawl them for indexing, pass them as data to software, or use them for any other lawful purpose, without financial, legal, or technical barriers other than those inseparable from gaining access to the internet itself). The journal is published by the Southern Scientific Centre of the Russian Academy of Science (Rostov-on-Don, Russia) since 2005 and is indexed/referenced in eLibrary.ru, Thomson Reuters: Zoological Records, BIOSIS Previews, Russian Science Citation Index, ZooBank, Crossref. A PDF and one print copy of this special issue will be sent to each author. Colour figures are free for print version. Other information can be found on the website of the journal: http://www.ssc-ras.ru/en/journal/caucasian_entomological_bulletin/ Dr. Maxim Nabozhenko Russian Academy of Sciences nalassus@mail.ru http://www.zin.ru/Animalia/Coleoptera/rus/nabozhen.htm
